description:
'''Coldplay''' are a British [[Rock music|rock]] band formed in [[London]] in 1997. They consist of vocalist and pianist [[Chris Martin]], guitarist [[Jonny Buckland]], bassist [[Guy Berryman]], drummer and percussionist [[Will Champion]], and manager [[Phil Harvey (band manager)|Phil Harvey]].{{efn|name=YEAH}} They are best known for [[List of Coldplay live performances|their live performances]], and [[Cultural impact of Coldplay|their impact on popular culture]] through [[Coldplay discography|their music]], advocacy and achievements.

The members of the band initially met at [[University College London]], calling themselves Big Fat Noises and changing to Starfish before the final name. After releasing the extended play ''[[Safety (EP)|Safety]]'' (1998) independently, they signed with [[Parlophone]] in 1999 and issued their debut album, ''[[Parachutes (Coldplay album)|Parachutes]]'' (2000), featuring the breakthrough single "[[Yellow (Coldplay song)|Yellow]]". It earned a [[Brit Award for British Album of the Year]] and a [[Grammy Award for Best Alternative Music Album]]. The group's follow-up, ''[[A Rush of Blood to the Head]]'' (2002), won the same accolades. ''[[X&Y]]'' (2005) completed what they considered a trilogy. Its successor, ''[[Viva la Vida or Death and All His Friends]]'' (2008), received a [[Grammy Award for Best Rock Album]]. Both records topped the charts in more than 30 countries and became the [[List of best-selling albums#Best-selling album by year worldwide|best-sellers of their respective years]] globally. ''Viva la Vida''{{'s}} [[Viva la Vida|title track]] was also the first song by British musicians to reach number one in the United States and United Kingdom simultaneously in the 21st century.

Coldplay further expanded their repertoire in subsequent albums, with ''[[Mylo Xyloto]]'' (2011), ''[[Ghost Stories (Coldplay album)|Ghost Stories]]'' (2014), ''[[A Head Full of Dreams]]'' (2015), ''[[Everyday Life (Coldplay album)|Everyday Life]]'' (2019), ''[[Music of the Spheres (Coldplay album)|Music of the Spheres]]'' (2021) and ''[[Moon Music]]'' (2024) drawing from genres like [[electronica]], [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[Ambient music|ambient]], [[disco]], [[funk]], [[Gospel music|gospel]], [[blues]] and [[progressive rock]]. The group's additional endeavours include philanthropy, politics and activism, supporting numerous humanitarian projects and donating 10% of their profits to charity. In 2018, [[Coldplay: A Head Full of Dreams|a career-spanning film]] directed by [[Mat Whitecross]] was released for their 20th anniversary.

With over 100 million albums sold worldwide, Coldplay are one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music acts of all time]].{{efn|name=HALPERIN|The term "records" is for album and single sales combined.<ref>{{Cite web |date=30 March 2021 |title=What's The Difference Between A Record And An Album? 5 Things To Know |url=https://thesoundofvinyl.us/blogs/vinyl-101/difference-between-a-record-and-album |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211215174331/https://thesoundofvinyl.us/blogs/vinyl-101/difference-between-a-record-and-album |archive-date=15 December 2021 |access-date=15 December 2021 |website=The Sound of Vinyl}}</ref> Coldplay, however, sold 100 million copies in albums alone, while [[Parlophone]] have not disclosed the amount of records.<ref>{{Cite web |date=6 October 2021 |title=Coldplay Re-Ups with Warner Music Group for Long-Term Deal Via Parlophone |url=https://variety.com/2021/music/news/coldplay-extends-warner-music-deal-parlophone-atlantic-1235081953/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20220108020320/https://variety.com/2021/music/news/coldplay-extends-warner-music-deal-parlophone-atlantic-1235081953/ |archive-date=8 January 2022 |access-date=6 October 2021 |website=Variety}}</ref>}} They are also the first group in [[Spotify]] history to reach 90 million [[List of most-streamed artists on Spotify|monthly listeners]]. [[Fuse (TV channel)|Fuse]] listed them among the [[List of awards and nominations received by Coldplay|most awarded artists]], which includes holding the record for most [[Brit Awards]] won by a band. In the United Kingdom, they have three of the 50 [[List of best-selling albums in the United Kingdom|best-selling albums]], the most [[UK Albums Chart]] number ones without missing the top (10), and the distinction of most played group of the 21st century on British media. In 2021, "[[My Universe (song)|My Universe]]" was the first song by a British group to debut atop the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. Coldplay have two of the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours|highest-grossing tours of all time]] and the [[List of most-attended concert tours|most-attended]]. The [[British Phonographic Industry]] called them one of the most "influential and pioneering acts" in the world, while the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] added ''A Rush of Blood to the Head'' to the [[List of 200 Definitive Albums in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame|200 Definitive Albums]] list and "Yellow" to the ''Songs That Shaped Rock and Roll'' exhibit. In 2023, the group were featured on the inaugural [[Time 100#Time 100 Climate|''Time'' 100 Climate]] ranking. Despite their popularity, they are considered [[Cultural impact of Coldplay#Public image|polarising cultural icons]].
